segment.source: How to Set Up Script Actions
segment.target: How to Set Up Script Actions

segment.source: How to Set Up Script Actions
segment.target: How to Set Up Script Actions

segment.source: How to Set Up Script Actions
segment.target: How to Set Up Script Actions

segment.source: The script actions editor allows the administrator to create actions to be performed during MED-V workspace setup, as well as to define the order in which they are performed.
segment.target: The script actions editor allows the administrator to create actions to be performed during MED-V workspace setup, as well as to define the order in which they are performed.

segment.source: The following is a list of actions that can be added to the domain setup script:
segment.target: The following is a list of actions that can be added to the domain setup script:

segment.source: Restart Windows—Restart Windows.
segment.target: Restart Windows—Restart Windows.

segment.source: Join Domain—If joining a domain, include this action and configure the user name, password, fully qualified domain name, NetBIOS domain name, and organization unit (optional).
segment.target: Join Domain—If joining a domain, include this action and configure the user name, password, fully qualified domain name, NetBIOS domain name, and organization unit (optional).

segment.source: Check Connectivity—Configure a server to connect to and verify that the MED-V workspace can connect to a network resource (such as the domain server).
segment.target: Check Connectivity—Configure a server to connect to and verify that the MED-V workspace can connect to a network resource (such as the domain server).

segment.source: Command Line—Configure a script in the MED-V workspace, and enter a command line that includes the path of the script and the script arguments.
segment.target: Command Line—Configure a script in the MED-V workspace, and enter a command line that includes the path of the script and the script arguments.

segment.source: Rename Computer—Rename the virtual machine computer based on the defined settings.
segment.target: Rename Computer—Rename the virtual machine computer based on the defined settings.

segment.source: Disable Auto-Logon—Disable Windows Auto-Logon.
segment.target: Disable Auto-Logon—Disable Windows Auto-Logon.

segment.source: This action should be added at the end of scripts that add the computer to the domain.
segment.target: This action should be added at the end of scripts that add the computer to the domain.

segment.source: How to Set Up Script Actions
segment.target: How to Set Up Script Actions

segment.source: To set up script actions
segment.target: To set up script actions

segment.source: On the VM Setup tab, click Script Editor.
segment.target: On the VM Setup tab, click Script Editor.

segment.source: In the Script Actions dialog box, click Add, and on the submenu, click the desired actions.
segment.target: In the Script Actions dialog box, click Add, and on the submenu, click the desired actions.

segment.source: Configure the actions as described in the following tables.
segment.target: Configure the actions as described in the following tables.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Rename Computer is configured in the VM Settings tab.
segment.target: Rename Computer is configured in the VM Settings tab.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Configure VM Computer Name Pattern Properties.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Configure VM Computer Name Pattern Properties.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To rename a computer, Windows must be restarted.
segment.target: To rename a computer, Windows must be restarted.

segment.source: It is recommended to add a Restart Windows action following a Rename Computer action.
segment.target: It is recommended to add a Restart Windows action following a Rename Computer action.

segment.source: Set the order of the actions by selecting an action and clicking Up or Down.
segment.target: Set the order of the actions by selecting an action and clicking Up or Down.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When running the Join Domain script, for the script to work, the user logged into the MED-V workspace virtual machine must have local administrator rights.
segment.target: When running the Join Domain script, for the script to work, the user logged into the MED-V workspace virtual machine must have local administrator rights.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When running the Disable Auto-Logon script, it is recommended to disable the local guest account used for the auto-logon once the initial setup is complete.
segment.target: When running the Disable Auto-Logon script, it is recommended to disable the local guest account used for the auto-logon once the initial setup is complete.

segment.source: Join Domain Properties
segment.target: Join Domain Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Credentials to use when joining the VM to the domain
segment.target: Credentials to use when joining the VM to the domain

segment.source: Select one of the following credentials to use when joining the VM to the domain:
segment.target: Select one of the following credentials to use when joining the VM to the domain:

segment.source: Use MED-V credentials—The end-user credentials.
segment.target: Use MED-V credentials—The end-user credentials.

segment.source: Use the following credentials—The credentials specified; enter a user name and password in the corresponding fields.
segment.target: Use the following credentials—The credentials specified; enter a user name and password in the corresponding fields.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The credentials you enter are visible to all MED-V workspace users.
segment.target: The credentials you enter are visible to all MED-V workspace users.

segment.source: It is not recommended to provide domain administrator credentials.
segment.target: It is not recommended to provide domain administrator credentials.

segment.source: Domain to join
segment.target: Domain to join

segment.source: Select one of the following:
segment.target: Select one of the following:

segment.source: Use the domain name utilized in starting the Workspace—Join the domain entered by the end user when logging into the MED-V client.
segment.target: Use the domain name utilized in starting the Workspace—Join the domain entered by the end user when logging into the MED-V client.

segment.source: To define the mapping from NetBIOS to fully qualified domain names, click Global domain mapping table.
segment.target: To define the mapping from NetBIOS to fully qualified domain names, click Global domain mapping table.

segment.source: In the global domain mapping table, click Add, enter a NetBIOS domain name and a Fully qualified domain name, and click OK.
segment.target: In the global domain mapping table, click Add, enter a NetBIOS domain name and a Fully qualified domain name, and click OK.

segment.source: Use the following domain name—Join the domain specified; enter a domain name and NetBIOS domain name in the corresponding fields.
segment.target: Use the following domain name—Join the domain specified; enter a domain name and NetBIOS domain name in the corresponding fields.

segment.source: Organization Unit
segment.target: Organization Unit

segment.source: An organization unit (OU) may be specified to join the computer to a specific OU.
segment.target: An organization unit (OU) may be specified to join the computer to a specific OU.

segment.source: The format must follow an OU distinguished name: OU=Organization Unit,Domain Controller (for example, OU=QATest, DC=il, DC=MED-V, DC=com).
segment.target: The format must follow an OU distinguished name: OU=Organization Unit,Domain Controller (for example, OU=QATest, DC=il, DC=MED-V, DC=com).

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: Only a single level OU is supported as is shown in the example above.
segment.target: Only a single level OU is supported as is shown in the example above.

segment.source: Check Connectivity Properties
segment.target: Check Connectivity Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: IP Address
segment.target: IP Address

segment.source: The IP Address of the server that you are verifying connection to.
segment.target: The IP Address of the server that you are verifying connection to.

segment.source: Port
segment.target: Port

segment.source: The port of the server that you are verifying connection to.
segment.target: The port of the server that you are verifying connection to.

segment.source: Timeout
segment.target: Timeout

segment.source: The number of seconds to wait for a response before timing out.
segment.target: The number of seconds to wait for a response before timing out.

segment.source: Command-Line Properties
segment.target: Command-Line Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Path
segment.target: Path

segment.source: The path of the command line.
segment.target: The path of the command line.

segment.source: Arguments
segment.target: Arguments

segment.source: Command-line arguments.
segment.target: Command-line arguments.

segment.source: Wait for exit
segment.target: Wait for exit

segment.source: Select the check box to wait for a return before continuing with the script actions.
segment.target: Select the check box to wait for a return before continuing with the script actions.

segment.source: Fail on error
segment.target: Fail on error

segment.source: Select this check box if the return is anything but the value specified.
segment.target: Select this check box if the return is anything but the value specified.

segment.source: Enter the value that will indicate the command as a success.
segment.target: Enter the value that will indicate the command as a success.

segment.source: Default: 0
segment.target: Default: 0

segment.source: Perform only once
segment.target: Perform only once

segment.source: Select this check box to run the command line only once.
segment.target: Select this check box to run the command line only once.

segment.source: If the script fails or is canceled, this command will not be performed again.
segment.target: If the script fails or is canceled, this command will not be performed again.

segment.source: This command line causes a restart of Windows in the Workspace
segment.target: This command line causes a restart of Windows in the Workspace

segment.source: Select this check box if the command line causes a restart after completion.
segment.target: Select this check box if the command line causes a restart after completion.

segment.source: Allow interaction
segment.target: Allow interaction

segment.source: Select this check box if the command will require user interaction.
segment.target: Select this check box if the command will require user interaction.

segment.source: Progress message
segment.target: Progress message

segment.source: Message to be displayed to the user while the command is running.
segment.target: Message to be displayed to the user while the command is running.

segment.source: Failure message
segment.target: Failure message

segment.source: Message to be displayed to the user if the command fails.
segment.target: Message to be displayed to the user if the command fails.

segment.source: When configuring the command-line action, several variables can be used as defined in the following table.
segment.target: When configuring the command-line action, several variables can be used as defined in the following table.

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Value
segment.target: Value

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: %MEDVUser%
segment.target: %MEDVUser%

segment.source: An authenticated user name.
segment.target: An authenticated user name.

segment.source: MED-V authenticated user name.
segment.target: MED-V authenticated user name.

segment.source: The user name and password can be used in the join domain VM setup script.
segment.target: The user name and password can be used in the join domain VM setup script.

segment.source: %MEDVPassword%
segment.target: %MEDVPassword%

segment.source: An authenticated password.
segment.target: An authenticated password.

segment.source: MED-V authenticated password.
segment.target: MED-V authenticated password.

segment.source: The user name and password can be used in the join domain VM setup script.
segment.target: The user name and password can be used in the join domain VM setup script.

segment.source: %MEDVDomain%
segment.target: %MEDVDomain%

segment.source: Configured domain.
segment.target: Configured domain.

segment.source: The domain configured in the MED-V authentication.
segment.target: The domain configured in the MED-V authentication.

segment.source: It can be used on the VM setup script.
segment.target: It can be used on the VM setup script.

segment.source: %DesiredMachineName%
segment.target: %DesiredMachineName%

segment.source: Computer name.
segment.target: Computer name.

segment.source: The unique computer name configured in the management application.
segment.target: The unique computer name configured in the management application.

segment.source: It can be used in the VM setup script.
segment.target: It can be used in the VM setup script.
